markdown.headingText: [Welcome to Multivariate Statistics and Methodology Using R]{.r-fit-text}
markdown.markdown:
```{r} #| label: setup #| include: false library(tidyverse) source('_theme/theme_quarto.R') ``` ## What We Will Learn {.smaller} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="45%"} #### Multilevel Modelling (Weeks 1-5) __Dan Mirman__ ![](img/dan.jpg){width=100px} - All things multilevel modeling - (aka mixed effects models/random effect models/hierarchical models) ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: {.column width="45%"} #### Data Reduction, Path, SEM (Weeks 7-11) __Aja Murray__ ![](img/aja.jpg){width=100px} - Principal Components Analysis (PCA) - Exploratory Factor Analysis (EFA) - Confirmatory Factor Analysis (CFA) - Path Analysis - Structural Equation Modelling (SEM) ::: :::: ## Shape of the Course ::: {layout=[[1,5],[1,5],[1,5],[1,5],[1,5]]} ![](img/lecture.svg){width=60px} **Lectures**
often include live coding ![](img/readings.png){width=60px} **Readings/Walkthroughs/Papers**
you're encouraged to work along with these ![](img/labs.svg){width=60px} **Labs (Exercises)**
work individually or in groups, with help on hand from a team of tutors ![](img/forum.svg){width=60px} **Discussion Forums and Support**
via learn page ![](img/exam.svg){width=60px} **Assessment**
Weekly quizzes and an individual report (covers both blocks) ::: --- :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ### Lectures & Readings - broadly, about _concepts_ + statistics + coding ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ### Exercises - broadly, _how to_ + coding + data manipulation + statistics - lots of hints, links to readings :::: myyellowblock solutions will be available at the end of each week :::: ::: :::: ## Labs :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} - a time and place to work on the exercises - encouraged to continue to work in groups from USMR - a team of tutors will be there to help ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ![](img/playmo_group.jpg) ::: :::: ::: mypinkblock - labs are the best place to get to grips with R and statistics - you are expected to attend ::: ## Discussions ![](img/forum_ss.png) - **piazza** discussion forums for the course on Learn + ask questions, share experiences, talk to the course team + post anonymously if preferred + an important way to keep in touch ## Support :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](img/playmo3.jpg) ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} :::: {.myyellowblock style="text-align: center;"} we are here to help you :::: - lectures: feel free to ask questions - labs: ask the tutors (they _want_ to help!) - piazza discussion forums: any time - office hours: see Learn page for details ::: :::: ## ![](img/exam.svg){width=70px style="transform: translateY(50%);"} Course Quizzes (20%) - 9 assessed quizzes - quizzes each have approximately 10 questions - for each quiz, **one attempt** which must be completed within 60 min . . . ::: myblock **released** Fridays at 17:00 **due** the following Friday at 17:00 **quizzes should be taken individually** ::: ## ![](img/exam.svg){width=70px style="transform: translateY(50%);"} Individual Report (80%) :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="45%"} ### What you'll have to do - Two sections (one for each part of the course) - Each section has a dataset and a series of research aims to address - Answers written up as a report (recommended structure: 'methods' and 'results') - .Rmd/.R file submitted separately ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: {.column width="45%"} ### What we're looking for - Selecting appropriate method(s) to address research aims - Explaining and justifying decisions made - Implementing methods in R - Interpreting and presenting findings ::: ::: ## ![](img/exam.svg){width=70px style="transform: translateY(50%);"} Individual Report (80%) ::: {.myblock} **released** Thursday 3rd April **due** Thursday 24th April at Midday ::: :::mypinkblock :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="90%"} Unlike USMR, this is an individual project! ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ![](img/imp.png) ::: :::: ::: ## Making the most of the course {.smaller} - active engagement! - attend lectures, ask questions in lectures/labs/discussion forum/office hours - no such thing as a stupid question - learning stats is cumulative - feel free to ask questions about things we learned in USMR too! - keep on top of quizzes - useful checkpoints! - remember: - some things will feel difficult at first - R's help docs contain examples! - google is your friend! - trial and error is a great way to learn! ## RStudio/RStudio Server :::mypinkblock :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="90%"} Please switch to using a local installation of RStudio. ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ![](img/imp.png) ::: :::: ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="45%"} #### Why? - We only have a license for the server for teaching purposes - it can't be used for dissertations. - Installing locally means no reliance on internet connection. - Good preparation for any future work you do that might need R! ::: ::: {.column width="10%"} ::: ::: {.column width="45%"} #### How? - instructions at - process is a bit more involved. Follow the instructions **carefully**! - just ask (labs/office hours) if you get stuck with it and we can try to help ::: :::: # End
